info.author: Flavio Curella
info.description: Django SOPA ====================================== For all your censoring needs. ``django-sopa`` helps you comply with the `Stop Online Piracy Act (SOPA) `_. It provides two template filters: ``is_censored`` ---------------------- Returns ``True`` or ``False`` if value contains links. ``censor`` ---------- Strips ```` elements, and replace links with blocks or a given strings. Accepts a replacement string as an optional parameter. If not specified, it will use the SOPA_REPLACE setting (defaults to ``'BLOCKS'``). The special value ``'BLOCKS'`` will replace every char in the link with a black square. :: "Defend your rights at www.eff.org."|censor >>> Defend your rights at ▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉. "Defend your rights at www.eff.org."|censor:"" >>> Defend your rights at . Settings ======== ``SOPA_REPLACE_MODE`` --------------------- Set to ``'LINKS'`` to only censor links, or to ``'ALL'`` to censor everything. Defaults to ``'ALL'``. With ``SOPA_REPLACE_MODE = 'LINKS'``:: "Defend your rights at www.eff.org.."|censor >>> Defend your rights at ▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉. With ``SOPA_REPLACE_MODE = 'ALL'``:: "Defend your rights at www.eff.org."|censor >>> ▉▉▉▉▉▉ ▉▉▉▉ ▉▉▉▉▉▉ ▉▉ ▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉▉ ``SOPA_REPLACE`` ---------------- Specifies what string the censored text will be replaced with. Set to the magic value ``'BLOCKS'`` to replace any non-whitespace characters with black squares. More Info ========= Alternatively, you can call your Senators to make sure you'd never need this app, or visit `American Censorship `_ for more information. info.summary: A django app for all your censoring needs.
